intro: Hebeclinium ianthinum, commonly known as the purple hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hebeclinium ianthinum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
